meanings.definition: A person who speaks indistinctly and quietly.
meanings.sent1: The mumblers in the library whispered to each other.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't understand the mumblers at the back of the room.
meanings.sent3: The mumblers at the meeting made everyone lean in to hear.
meanings.sent4: The mumblers in the play were like ghosts haunting the stage.
meanings.sent5: The mumblers' voices were as soft as feathers floating in the air.

meanings.sent1: The mumblers in the crowd were hard to hear.
meanings.sent2: She always gets annoyed by the mumblers in the movie theater.
meanings.sent3: The mumblers in the group chat kept sending confusing messages.
meanings.sent4: The mumblers in the forest seemed to be speaking a secret language.
meanings.sent5: The mumblers' words melted into a quiet hum in the room.
